intro: Mimulopsis catati, commonly known as the catati mimulopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Mimulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Mimulopsis catati is considered a rare and endangered species.
